_header: Every man should teach this lore

BLHar665.First Lines:
Euery man with good ententKepe well Crystys
                    commeundement…
BLHar665.Last Lines:
…In to hys blyss þat we may paaceAt the last day of
                    iugement
BLHar665.Note: Stanza 1 has only two lines. “Sit laus & gloris cristo” written above as if for a heading (f. 90).
BLHar665.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             “Zwei Umschreibungen der Zehn Gebote im mittelenglische Versen.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         85 (1890): 45-8: 45-6.

Lam853.First Lines:
EUery man schulde teche þis loreTo hise children with good
                    ententAnd do it him silf euermoreTo kepe weel goddis
                    comaundement…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Þese ten to kepe þou ȝeue us graceÞat on
                    the roode was al to rentIn to his blis þat we mowe passeAt
                    þe laste day of Iugement
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 104-5.
